p._value:
openssl-nseq,
nseq - create or examine a Netscape certificate sequence

_values:
command takes a file containing a Netscape certificate
sequence and prints out the certificates contained in it or
takes a file of certificates and converts it into a Netscape
certificate sequence.

p._value:
This specifies the input
filename to read or standard input if this option is not
specified.

specifies the output filename
or standard output by default.

_values:
normally a Netscape certificate
sequence will be input and the output is the certificates
contained in it. With the

option the situation
is reversed: a Netscape certificate sequence is created from
a file of certificates.

p._value:
Output the
certificates in a Netscape certificate sequence

_values:
encoded form uses the same headers
and footers as a certificate:

p._value:
A Netscape
certificate sequence is a Netscape specific form that can be
sent to browsers as an alternative to the standard PKCS#7
format when several certificates are sent to the browser:
for example during certificate enrollment. It is used by
Netscape certificate server for example.

_values:
This program
needs a few more options: like allowing

input and output files and allowing
multiple certificate files to be used.
